type.name: dmExtractIdentityOption

value.description: Extracts identity from basic authorization header
value.name: basic

value.description: Extracts identity by using an HTML form
value.name: html-form

value.description: Extracts identity by using a redirect
value.name: redirect

type.summary: Options for extracting resource owner's identity

type.name: dmUserAuthOption

value.description: Authenticates users by sending API requests to an API user registry
value.name: user-registry

type.summary: Options for authenticating the resource owner's identity

type.name: dmUserAZOption

value.description: Authorizes users by using an HTML form
value.name: html-form

type.summary: Options for authorizing the resource owner

property.name: Name
property.summary: Display name of the entry

property.name: Description
property.summary: Description of the entry

object.name: AssemblyActionUserSecurity
object.summary: Configure the identity extraction, authentication, and authorization of end users.

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: UserSummary
property.summary: Brief summary for Assembly action.

property.name: Title
property.summary: The title for Assembly action.

property.description: The correlation path specifies the part of the API definition that correlates with the assembly action. This path is exposed in the debug data by the API Gateway for use by debugging tools. For example, for an API configuration that is retrieved from API Connect and specified in an OpenAPI (Swagger 2.0) document with IBM extensions, this path is the JSON path to the assembly policy in the IBM extensions section of the document. The path can be expressed in any form that the debugging tool can correlate to the API definition.
property.summary: The path which correlates the assembly action to a specific part of the API specification.
property.name: CorrelationPath
ActionDebug
property.summary: Whether to enable GatewayScript debugger in assembly actions
property.description: <p>Controls whether to enable the GatewayScript debugger to troubleshoot the following GatewayScript file or script. <ul><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript file that is called from the assembly GatewayScript action.</li><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript file that is invoked by the GatewayScript associated XSLT extension functions or elements, such as the <tt>gatewayscript()</tt> extension function, from the assembly XSLT action.</li><li>Troubleshoot the GatewayScript script that is invoked through the <tt>value</tt> or the <tt>default</tt> property in the JSON file from the assembly map action.</li></ul></p><p>To debug a file or script, the following conditions must be met:</p><ul><li>The file contains one or more <tt>debugger;</tt> statements at the points in your script where you want to start debugging.</li><li>The GatewayScript debugger is enabled.</li></ul><p>Then you can run the <tt>debug-action</tt> command to debug.</p>

property.name: FactorID
property.summary: Enter the string that identifies the results of factor authentication.
property.description: The string that identifies the results of factor authentication in the API context.

property.name: ExtractIdentityMethod
property.summary: Determines which identity extraction method to use
property.description: The method to extract end user credentials.

property.name: EIStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if identity extraction fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if identity extraction fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: UserContextVariable
property.summary: Enter the period-delimited string to locate the context variable that contains the user's name.
property.description: The period-delimited string to navigate the API context to locate the context variable that contains the user's name.

property.name: PassContextVariable
property.summary: Enter the period-delimited string to locate the context variable that contains the user's password.
property.description: The period-delimited string to navigate the API context to locate context variable that contains the user's password.

property.name: RedirectURL
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment to redirect the request, which can include context variables
property.description: The URL fragment to redirect the request to obtain user credentials. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: RedirectTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the allowable time for the transaction to complete before the redirect fails.
property.description: The allowable time in seconds for the transaction to complete before the redirect fails.

property.name: QueryParameters
property.summary: Query parameters to append to the redirect.
property.description: Enter query parameters to append to the redirect. Query parameters provide additional information.

property.name: EIDefaultForm
property.summary: Indicates whether to use the default form or a custom form.
property.description: Whether to use the default form or a custom form. When enabled, returns the default login page to obtain credentials. When disabled, define the configuration to return the custom login page.

property.name: EICustomForm
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment of the custom login page, which can include context variables
property.description: The URL fragment of the custom login page. This page collects user name and password information. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: EICustomFormClientProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile to secure the connection to retrieve the custom login page.
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure the connection to the remote server to retrieve the custom login page.

property.name: EICustomFormContentSecurityPolicy
property.summary: Specify the value to use for the HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header for the custom login page.
property.description: The value to use for the HTTP <tt>Content-Security-Policy</tt> response header for the custom login page. This response header allows you to control which resources the user agent can load. Generally, you set server origins and script endpoints to detect and mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking, and other injection attacks.

property.name: EIFormTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the time to limit the transaction.
property.description: The time to limit the transaction before the identity extraction request fails.

property.name: UserAuthMethod
property.summary: Specify which authentication method to use.
property.description: Which authentication method to use.

property.name: AUStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if authentication fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if authentication fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: UserRegistry
property.summary: The user registry to authenticate the incoming API request.
property.description: Specifies the API user registry to authenticate incoming API requests. The supported registries are API authentication URL and API LDAP.

property.name: AuthResponseHeadersPattern
property.summary: Enter the regular expression to select which response headers to add to the API context, which can include context variables.
property.description: The regular expression to select which response headers to add to the API context for access by subsequent actions. The default value is a case-insensitive search on the <tt>x-api</tt> prefix. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: AuthResponseCredentialHeader
property.summary: Enter the response header that contains the authenticated credentials, which can include context variables.
property.description: The response header that contains the authenticated credentials. The default value is <tt>X-API-Authenticated-Credential</tt> . The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: UserAZMethod
property.summary: Specify which authorization method to use.
property.description: Which authorization method to use.

property.name: AZStopOnError
property.summary: Indicates whether to stop processing if authorization fails.
property.description: Whether to stop processing if authorization fails. If failed, stops the assembly and return an error.

property.name: AZDefaultForm
property.summary: Indicates whether to use the default form or a custom form.
property.description: Whether to use the default form or a custom form. When enabled, returns the default authorization page to obtain authorization. When disabled, define the configuration to return the custom authorization page.

property.name: AZCustomForm
property.summary: Enter the URL fragment of the custom authorization page, which can include context variables.
property.description: The URL fragment of the custom authorization page. This page obtains permission from the end user. The value can include one or more run time context variables in the format <tt>$(context-variable)</tt> .

property.name: AZCustomFormClientProfile
property.summary: Specify the TLS client profile to secure the connection to retrieve the custom authorization page.
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure the connection to the remote server to retrieve the custom authorization page.

property.name: AZCustomFormContentSecurityPolicy
property.summary: Specify the value to use for the HTTP Content-Security-Policy response header for the custom authorization page.
property.description: The value to use for the HTTP <tt>Content-Security-Policy</tt> response header for the custom authorization page. This response header allows you to control which resources the user agent can load. Generally, you set server origins and script endpoints to detect and mitigate cross-site scripting (XSS), clickjacking, and other injection attacks.

property.name: AZFormTimeLimit
property.summary: Enter the time to limit the transaction.
property.description: The time to limit the transaction before the authorization request fails.

property.name: AZTableDisplayCheckboxes
property.summary: Add check boxes to the entries.
property.description: Allows entries to be selected.

property.name: AZTableDynamicEntries
property.summary: Enter a period-delimited context variable that adds dynamic entries to display.
property.description: The period-delimited context variable supports space delimited names, a JSON array of names, or a JSON array of objects with name and description.

property.name: AZTableDefaultEntry
property.summary: Add an entry to the table. The entry contains a name and description.
property.description: The table displays entries that are being authorized.

property.name: Hostname
property.summary: The hostname to set instead of the incoming hostname
property.description: The hostname for the original URL in the redirect or HTML form requests.
